definitions.definition: the temporary release of an accused person awaiting trial, sometimes on condition that a sum of money be lodged to guarantee their appearance in court.
examples: he has been released on bail
synonyms: pledge; archaicgage "he was released on bail"

definitions.definition: money paid for the release an accused person as security.
examples: surety, security, assurance, indemnity, indemnification; Morebond, guarantee, pledge; archaicgage "he was released on bail"Morebond, guarantee, pledge; gage he was released on bail

definitions.definition: release or secure the release of (a prisoner) on payment of bail.
examples: his son called home to get bailed out of jail

definitions.definition: a bar that holds something in place, in particular.
a bar that guides fishing line on a reel.
a bar on a typewriter or computer printer that holds the paper steady.
a bar on a crampon that fits into a groove in the sole of a boot.
a bar separating horses in an open stable.
an arched handle, such as on a bucket or a teapot.
examples: drawers fitted with brass bail handles

definitions.definition: either of the two crosspieces bridging the stumps, which the bowler and fielders try to dislodge with the ball to get the batsman out.
scoop water out of (a ship or boat).
examples: the first priority is to bail out the boat with buckets

definitions.definition: scoop (water) out of a ship or boat.
examples: I started to use my hands to bail out the water

definitions.definition: abandon a commitment, obligation, or responsibility.
examples: after 12 years of this, including Sunday Mass with the family, I bailed

definitions.definition: let (someone) down by failing to fulfill a commitment, obligation, or responsibility.
examples: he looks a little like the guy who bailed on me
